page.title: 10HOME LIFE, PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: The farms are isolated, but with radio and/or television, all keep in touch with everyday affairs. The effect of this showed at Gownfold Farm, where the farmer's wife opened her door a mere crack to ask our business. Robberies and muggings today make everyone wary of strange callers. Once sure of our purpose she was as hospitable as everyone else. Tea or coffee was offered and despite being busy, our questions were answered willingly.For women, household chores, gardening, providing hot meals at home or in the fields, fill their daytime. For winter evenings there is knitting, television, reading, and visiting other farms. A magnificent tapestry now exhibited in the church was made by Wisborough Green Women's Institute, showing landscape and houses of the area, including Hawkhurst Court.
